Comment.Language: Let the third priest light the third lamp and say the third prayer.

Text.Language: Kc~marwout P[oic Pennou] pia~gioc: pic/ini n~te nen'u,/: qen neklale,/mi anoujai: w~ pimane~cwou eynanef e~tafkw] n~ca pie~cwou etcwrem: v/et] n~ounom] n~n/etoi n~kouji n~h/t.
Blessed are You, O Lord the Holy One, the Physician of our souls. By Your stripes we are healed, O Good Shepherd, who seek the sheep that is lost; who give consolation to the faint-hearted.

v/e~taftal[o n~t~swmi n~Cimwn qen pecq~mom eynast: ouoh pic~nof efsat e~bol qaroc e~bol qen pecswni n~ar,eoc: v/e~tafy~re t~seri n~]<ananea~ erremhe e~bol qen pip~neuma n~a~kayarton.

Who healed the mother-in-law of Peter in her grievous fever; and the issue of her who suffered from her long-standing disease; who delivered the daughter of the woman of Canaan from the unclean spirit.

Who forgave the debtor that which he owed, who forgave the harlot, and the lame man; who justified the publican;

V/e~tafswp e~rof n~]o~mologia~ n~te piconi qen t~qae~ n~te pefwnq: ouoh aferh~mot naf m~piparadicoc: v/etw~li m~v~nobi m~pikocmoc: v/e~tau]ift naf hijen pic~tauroc qen pefouws m~min m~mof.
Who accepted the confession of the thief at the end of his life, and bestowed paradise upon him; who took away the sin of the world; who were nailed to the Cross of Your own will.

Ten]ho ouoh tentwbh m~mok ouoh tene~pikalicye ouoh tenws oub/k: eyrek,w e~bol )nim): nem a~non hwn qa neke~biaik n~nena~nomia~ t/rou n~aidion ouoh n~ataidion.
We pray and entreat You, and call upon You and cry unto You to forgive the sins of (...), and us also Your servants, all our iniquities, whether personal or impersonal,

Ite qen oue~mi: i~te qen oumetate~mi: na pie~jwrh nem na pie~hoou: n/e~taui~ e~bol n~q/ten: nem n/e~taui~ e~h~r/i e~jwn e~bol hiten hankeouon: n/e~te e~bol qen niecyecic eyouwnh nem nip~roherecic eth/p: n/e~te e~bol qen nijinkim n~te pip~neuma nem picwma.

whether in knowledge or ignorance, those of night and those of day, which have come forth from ourselves, and which have come upon us through others, those of open-perception and those of hidden deliberation, those from the motions of the soul and of the body.

Je n~yok ounou] n~a~gayoc ouoh m~mairwmi: matoubo n~nenparap~twma t/rou: ouoh [imwit qajwn ouoh matoten: hina n~tenmosi qen nimwit n~te piwnq n~e~neh: v~mwit an n~te v~mou n~e~w~nion.
For You are a good God and Lover of Mankind; cleanse all our transgressions, and guide us and help us that we may walk in the ways of eternal life and not the way of eternal death.

Aha P[oic a~ricun,wrin m~pekbwk (nim): n~nefparap~twma t/rou mah rwf e~bol qen pekc~mou: ouoh coutwn nefjij e~bol e~p~jini~ri n~nekentol/.
Yes, O Lord, pardon Your servant (...) all his transgressions, and fill him with Your blessing, and direct his hands to do Your commandments.

Cebte nef[alauj e~piman[oji n~te pioujai: a~ricobt e~nefmeloc nem nefmeui~ qen tekjom.
Guide his feet into the path of health; fence his members and his thoughts with Your power.

You, O Lord, said unto us through Your holy apostles, â€œWhatever you bind on earth will be bound in heaven, and whatever you loose on earth will be loosed in heaven.â€?

Mv~r/] e~takcwtem e~Iezekiac qen pihojhej n~te tef'u,/: qen ]ounou n~te pefmou: ouoh m~pekeratcwtem n~ca pef]ho.pair/] on cwtem e~roi a~nok qa pekbwk n~e~la,ictoc qen taiounou yai: ouoh nai m~pekbwk (nim): ouoh icje nefnobi aua~sai e~masw: je n~yok akouahcahni m~pi,w e~bol sasf n~cop s~be.

Even as You heard Hezekiah in the affliction of his soul in the hour of his death, and were not deaf to his prayers; so again hear me the least of Your servants in this hour, and have mercy on Your servant (...) and if his sins be many, command their forgiveness unto seventy times seven.

Ouoh tenouwrp m~piseph~mot n~neknai nem tekmetnis]: nem piw~ou nak nem Pekiwt n~a~gayoc n~atar,/: nem Pekp~neuma eyouab n~reftanqo: ]nou nem n~c/ou niben: nem sa e~neh n~te nie~neh t/rou a~m/n.

And we offer thaksgiving for Your mercies and Your greatness, and glory unto You and Your good Father without beginning, and Your Holy Life-Giving Spirit. Now and ever, and unto the age of all the ages. Amen.
